delete_data(table: str, key: str, value: int) → str[source]

This function deletes data from db table

Parameters:

  • table (str) – Name of table from database

  • value (str) – value condition argument

  • key (str) – key of note in db table

:return Notification log :rtype str

delete_data_pair(table: str, key1: str, key2: str, value1: int, value2: int) → str[source]

This function deletes data from db table with two primary keys

Parameters:

  • table (str) – Name of table from database

  • value1 (str) – value condition argument

  • value2 (str) – second value condition argument

  • key1 (str) – key of note in db table

  • key2 (str) – second key of note in db table

:return Notification log :rtype str

static get_connection() → Connection[source]

This function returns connector to mysql database

:return Pymysql connection :rtype pymysql.Connection

get_table(table: str) → list[dict][source]

This function returns list with notes from db table

Parameters:

table (str) – Name of table from database

:return List of dictionaries from database table :rtype List[dict]

insert_data(table: str, data: str, keys: str) → str[source]

This function inserts data to a db table

Parameters:

  • table (str) – Name of table from database

  • data (str) – values to insert

  • keys (str) – keys of db table

:return Notification log :rtype str
